title.value: Lagrangian Properties and Control of Soft Robots Modeled with Discrete Cosserat Rods
title.justification: The title is gathered from the top of the page.
title.quote: Lagrangian Properties and Control of Soft Robots Modeled with Discrete Cosserat Rods

extractions.description: This paper investigates the control and dynamic performance of soft robots modeled with discrete Cosserat rods. It establishes the structural Lagrangian properties of the piecewise constant strain (PCS) model and exploits these properties to design controllers for various strain goal states.

type.justification: The paper conducts numerical simulations to establish the convergence of control methods for soft robots, indicating empirical research.
type.quote: Our numerical results establish convergence to desired equilibrium throughout the continuum in all of our tests.

name.justification: The paper deals with the control and modeling of soft robots, which falls under the field of Robotics.
name.quote: Soft robots are attracting wide adoption in the automation community owing to their improved bending, torsion, configurability, and compliance properties.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the control mechanisms and performance analysis of soft robots.
name.quote: We exploit these for control on various strain goal states.

name.justification: The paper analyzes the dynamic performance and convergence of the models under different loading scenarios.
name.quote: Our numerical results establish convergence to desired equilibrium throughout the continuum in all of our tests.

name.justification: The paper mentions using Torch for the implementation of the numerical integration schemes.
name.quote: We adopted the recursive articulated-body algorithm [7] and integrate the right-hand-side of differential equations (24) and (31) using a Runge-Kutta-Fehlberg (RKF) adaptive scheme implemented in Python and Torch [15]

referenced_paper_title.value: Pytorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides insights into the Torch library which is utilized for numerical computations in this study.
